tree.original_reasoning:
We are given two Java programs that are meant to be executed in sequence.

First, let's understand what each program does:

1. File 1: atcoder_ABC150_C
   - Reads an integer `n`.
   - Reads two strings (each string is built by concatenating `n` tokens from the input).
   - Generates all permutations of the string "123...n" (with `n` digits).
   - For each of the two input strings, it finds the index of that string in the lexicographically ordered list of permutations.

    program chain
        implicit none
        integer :: n, i, j, fact, counter, k, idx1, idx2
        character(len=1) :: tokens(16)   ! 2*n <= 16
        character(len=:), allocatable :: base, str1, str2
        character(len=:), allocatable :: current
        character(len=:), allocatable :: perms(:)   ! array of strings
        character(len=20) :: str_k
        character :: c, next_char

        ! Read n
        read(*,*) n

        ! Read 2*n tokens
        do i=1, 2*n
            read(*,*) tokens(i)
        end do

        ! Build str1 and str2
        str1 = ""
        do i=1, n
            str1 = str1 // tokens(i)
        end do
        str2 = ""
        do i=n+1, 2*n
            str2 = str2 // tokens(i)
        end do

        ! Build base string "123...n"
        base = ""
        do i=1, n
            base = base // achar(iachar('0')+i)
        end do

        ! Compute factorial of n
        fact = 1
        do i=2, n
            fact = fact * i
        end do

        ! Allocate perms array
        allocate(character(len=n) :: perms(fact))

        ! Allocate current for permutation building
        current = repeat(' ', n)

        ! Generate permutations
        counter = 0
        call gen_perm_recurse(base, 1, current, perms, counter, n)

        ! Find indices of str1 and str2 in perms
        idx1 = -1
        idx2 = -1
        do i=1, fact
            if (perms(i) == str1) then
                idx1 = i
            end if
            if (perms(i) == str2) then
                idx2 = i
            end if
        end do

        k = abs(idx1 - idx2)

        ! Convert k to string without spaces
        write(str_k, '(I0)') k
        c = str_k(1:1)
        next_char = achar(iachar(c)+1)

        ! Output the integer k and a newline, then the next_char without newline.
        write(*, '(I0)') k
        write(*, '(A)', advance='no') next_char

    contains

        recursive subroutine gen_perm_recurse(base, pos, current, perms, counter, n)
            character(len=*), intent(in) :: base
            integer, intent(in) :: pos
            character(len=n), intent(inout) :: current
            character(len=n), intent(inout) :: perms(:)
            integer, intent(inout) :: counter
            integer, intent(in) :: n

            integer :: i, L
            character(len=len(base)) :: new_base   ! length will be L-1

            L = len(base)
            if (L == 0) then
                counter = counter + 1
                perms(counter) = current
            else
                do i=1, L
                    ! Place base(i) at position pos
                    current(pos:pos) = base(i:i)
                    new_base = base(1:i-1) // base(i+1:)
                    call gen_perm_recurse(new_base, pos+1, current, perms, counter, n)
                end do
            end if
        end subroutine gen_perm_recurse

    end program chain
